snippet.textDisplay: I think as a person who has a past as well shouldn't be the focus of who a person is now. People can change in regards to who they "used to be.." we are human we make plenty mistakes unknowingly and knowingly. And I personally appreciate the sacrifice made on my behalf from Christ Jesus. He made me a new creature in Him and through Him. Although we can't erase what may have been done in our lives, past wise, I still think folks need to step back and realize they have one too. And just because other folks dont know what they have done in the closet doesn't make them better. It makes them fallible as well. That's why there is no perfect person but Christ! Thank you God!!

snippet.textDisplay:
In the pain’t


What is it
About Gayle and Oprah
Are they still scorned from many years ago when we could not set them free
The black man
You and me

Or is it some sort of jealousy that offers ones legacy that will surely affect the destiny of you and me

What is it with Oprah
That’s a question bothering me
Is her mind still sound
Has it ever been
Will it ever be

What is it about Mo’Nique
That’s so unique and genuine
She speaks her mind and suddenly she must rewind
Retract and apologize
Is that wise
Are we slaves yet

What is it about Snoop that makes him so bold
Is he really still one of us
After all this time
Did he not sell his soul like the best of them
Did he really just say what I thought he said
Is he seeing more red than blue while stars still swirl around Gayle’s head from the blow not the weed, the weave, like a nest, where egos go to rest

I wonder what Barack thinks of this
What about Michelle
I wonder...
While we wander...
Like freed dogs after popping the chain
Like freed slaves being Willie Lynched
Like an original people who can’t remember their names
Like maimed animals, maimed in the brain
Handcuffed by the cerebral cortex
Shakled in shame...

I wonder what Kobe’s family thinks
Are they thinking
Or still morning on this morning

On a damn world court, dragging this man’s name through mud
I understand Snoops position, he’s the center of love

snippet.textDisplay:
My only other comment about this matter is this. If a black man chooses to marry out of his race then he is bashing his race.  He has freedom of choice.

The negative comments said about this man or others are not race bashing when this man 
( and others) in question has already bashed his own race by coupling with a woman who 
neither looks like, 
acts like, 
believes like 
or has the perspective of life like his own black mother.

No one is race bashing Kobe he already did that himself by his choice of wife.

The man is a human and not a god. If you like and respect him that is fine Not everyone did.

As for me: very, very few wealthy people of any race or gender get respect, honor or admiration from me. Including Kobe Bryant.

snippet.textDisplay:
My take on this helicopter crash is this:
There are three camps in which most people land. Camp one the poor people think they can con everybody. Camp two the middle class people who blatantly lie about this or that. Camp three are the wealthy who think they do not have to obey the laws of nature and science.

The foolish wealthy on that helicopter thought they did not have to follow the laws of science or nature and took an ill advised trip which cost them their lives.

snippet.textDisplay: At this point I will not watch this interview just comment. I used to enjoy cbs morning show when it was Gayle King and Charlie Rose. When Rose left the show over sexual misconduct  allegations I remember Gayle’s  reaction was cold and harsh. This surprised me because she and Charlie would make playful jokes with sexual overtones on every show all the time, it was entertainer to see how close they would come to crossing the line. I tired to watch the show again but it was never the same with out him, and I could not get over the way Gayle treated a former cohost and friend with such coldness. Now we have this Interview with Kobe and see that same coldness coming out. I can’t  say I will never way the show again because I have already stopped but I hope their viewership goes down or they take Gayle King off .

snippet.textDisplay: Thank God Lisa was around.Gayle should have been more careful with her career.I would not be surprised if Oprah put Gayle up to this because Oprah has always done this with Michael Jackson and maybe other people.

snippet.textDisplay:
I just can't!!
I don't like the Cancel Culture either but this was unsolicited; especially so soon. We're expected to question our celebration of his life and legacy??
1. Are we generally surprised the public supports a celebrity they don't know?
2. IMO highlighting the case dismissal reason, did nothing but suggest foul play; casting lingering doubt over Kobe's character...he isn't here 😕
Gayle's part of a wider circle that HAS done so much for our communities.
She's smart. That's why these throw away comments and the indifference makes this more hurtful.
Anybody would know the deal with that question...otherwise why ask if it's ok to ask? Why put that on Lisa? 😒
That's a question you'd genuinely ask yourself/producers before airtime; not after the damage is done! At least approach it with some sensitivity. It was tasteless! Regardless of whether it was tactical it wasn't OK.
snippet.textOriginal:
I just can't!! 
I don't like the Cancel Culture either but this was unsolicited; especially  so soon. We're expected to question our celebration of his life and legacy??
1. Are we generally surprised the public supports a celebrity they don't know?

Gayle's part of a wider circle that HAS done so much for our communities. 
She's smart. That's why these throw away comments and the indifference makes this more hurtful. 
Anybody would know the deal with that question...otherwise why ask if it's ok to ask? Why put that on Lisa? 😒
That's a question you'd genuinely ask yourself/producers before airtime; not after the damage is done! At least approach it with some sensitivity. It was tasteless! Regardless of whether it was tactical it wasn't OK.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm sure I have heard similar questions being asked by reporters before. Yes it was while people were mourning. From a grieving perspective, the question is in poor taste. From a reporters perspective. She asked a valid question. Lisa answered beautifully. Yea everyone is saying great things but are we forgetting that he might have been wrong? She didn't ask his wife, She asked a friend. This comes with being famous. Since Gayle took the risk of asking and attacking, this risk has back fired. She must just lay low and in time see can start addressing people.

I'm not a Kobe or Gayle fan. But this pop up.

snippet.textDisplay: CBS and Gayle King was WRONG. GK came at Leslie 4 times in this interview about his past from 2003, that was settled and done with. Horrible for GK to tell Leslie that she wouldn't know if he was a type to degrade woman. They were  family. GK was trying to make a statement and put him in that category as a predator. Kobe Bryant came forth to the public and apologized. The man is dead and his daughter. Now Kobe's Wife and daughters are grieving and other family and friends. You all Really Need to Stop being Disrespectful. Respect the dead and their Family. And stop this foolishness and take a seat. I will continue to pray for the Bryant Family. My heart goes out to them. Kobe Bryant, his wife, daughters and family do not deserve this disrespect , definitely with all the Great work and legacy he left behind.

snippet.textDisplay: the interview was beautiful. gayle is a true journalist. i heard about this sex allegation when i watch ET and this was before galye did her interview. where was the backlash then? this was the day after he passed away that's when i heard about the sex allegation: not during this interview. that is true journalism. i dont want people to remember me for the good i did alone, but all of me. a man's legacy is not the good he did, but what you remembered him doing. this was a beautiful interview.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm sure yall heard about this interview. My opinion, I think it was completely inappropriate the questions she asked about Kobe's trial at such a time. However I LOVED LOVED LOVED the responses that Lisa Leslie gave! She was so respectful to Kobe as if he were her brother and yet so graceful in she shutting down Gayle King in her effort to tear down Kobe's legacy. That was awesome Lisa!! 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾

To me, it seems that this minterview was meant to be so that Lisa could be used to shut down any outlet that would ever try to mess up Kobe' Bryant's legacy which he works sooooo hard to build in order to be a great example to other black boys AND girls!

snippet.textDisplay: Not being a sports fan, I do remember the MEDIA running away with the story about these accusations.. sadly, that's what stuck out in my mind when this tragedy happened.. the "oh yeah, he's the guy that was accused..."  (No disrespect intended.)  I blame the media for that unfortunate recognition.. and, as we see even today, they have not learned anything about having integrity and taste with honest, fact-based reporting.  I don't watch msm but I'd have to agree that this topic being brought up at this time, was highly inappropriate.

snippet.textDisplay: The over reactions of some to Gayle's questions about Kobe's Colorado sexual assault case are saddening. Snoop's comments were ridiculous. She was only doing her job. She asked softball questions that were relevant due to Lisa being a female and close friend. She didn't dig or over do it. Unfortunately, Kobe put himself in a bad situation even if the situation was consensual. I am a huge Kobe fan, but this situation is a stain on his legacy that did take place no matter whether you choose to believe it was consensual or not. Regardless of the side you fall on, Gayle did her job. Just because we are fans of his greatness doesn't mean we should forget his shortcomings. He was a champion and sure HOF, but he also helped broke up a possible run of championships greater than Jordan's. He was seemingly a great father, but made some sort of a mistake as a husband in Colorado--be it assault or infidelity. Just facts.
snippet.textOriginal: The over reactions of some to Gayle's questions about Kobe's Colorado sexual assault case are saddening. Snoop's comments were ridiculous. She was only doing her job. She asked softball questions that were relevant due to Lisa being a female and close friend. She didn't dig or over do it. Unfortunately, Kobe put himself in a bad situation even if the situation was consensual. I am a huge Kobe fan, but this situation is a stain on his legacy that did take place no matter whether you choose to believe it was consensual or not. Regardless of the side you fall on, Gayle did her job. Just because we are fans of his greatness doesn't mean we should forget his shortcomings. He was a champion and sure HOF, but he also helped broke up a possible run of championships greater than Jordan's. He was seemingly a great father, but made some sort of a mistake as a husband in Colorado--be it assault or infidelity. Just facts.
